title: Full Bayesian Survival Models for Analyzing Human Breast Tumors
segmentation: Hello, my name is Fuccaro to thank you for the introduction and thank you for the invitation to this workshop.
So today I'm going to talk about Bayesian survival models for analyzing human breast cancers and so this is joint work with my colleagues from TH with Thomas folks and Joe Bowman.

Suze Orman is a PhD student in my group and Peterbilt and hold them, or are two pathologists from the University Hospital Zurich and Ekedahl is also pathologist from the University Hospital in our hand in Germany.

So let me start with a short overview of this talk, so I'm going to spend, say, two sentences about breast cancer and little bit little bit more sense about this data is tissue microarrays and then I will give a very short introduction to survival models survival regression.
I will introduce a fully Bayesian approach to survival modeling.
I will talk a little bit about feature selection for biomarker detection.
I will introduce.
Mixtures of experts of mixtures of survival experts to analyze this data.
And so I'll close with some results on a novel.
Very interesting breast cancer.

Well, much progress in finding prognostic markers.
